unnormalised: Local tailor, Pappu Tailors, embroiled in size controversy! Customers are in stitches, but not in a good way. It seems Pappu Ji, known for his “ekdum perfect” fits, has been having a bit of a measuring mishap. Reports are flooding in – shirts with sleeves that are 3 inches too long, pants that could house a small family (waist size allegedly off by a whopping 10 cm!), and blouses that are… well, let’s just say they defy gravity.

unnormalised: "I asked for a simple kurta," lamented Mrs. Sharma, a regular customer, "and it came back looking like a tent! The shoulder width was at least 45 cm when I'm clearly smaller than that!". Others echoed her sentiments. Mr. Khan claims his trousers were so long, he could have swept the entire street of Chandni Chowk, adding a solid 1.5 metres of unwanted length.
